posts.name: William J
posts.cooked:
Hello! One of our newer members was struggling to get MKCAD working on their device. It would ask them to link an account, and they would select it but it would just glitch out as such. We tried reinstalling and reloading but nothing has solved the issue. Other members were able to install it no problem. Has anyone encountered this? Is there any way to get some sort of debug? Thanks!

Google Drive file.

posts.name: ehochstein
posts.cooked:
This has happened to 461 multiple times, I haven‚Äôt been able to determine the exact cause as of yet. In most of our cases switching to a different computer or waiting until the next meeting seems to have fixed it.

Probably not related but we are in the process of transitioning all of our computers to linux and FRCDesign Deriver. FRCDesign Deriver works fine on MacOS and Windows but will fail to load with any computer running linux. I‚Äôll be troubleshooting this over the next week or two and will update here if I find a solution.

posts.name: Julia Schatz
posts.cooked: Check out the troubleshooting steps on Troubleshooting please- most issues like this are due to browser privacy settings. I‚Äôm not sure which browser is being used here, but most issues can be solved by changing browser settings or disabling privacy extensions on this page.

posts.name: William J
posts.cooked: Thanks so much for help. The issue was happening on safari. Switching to chrome solved it. I think its some sort of browser privacy in safari that was causing the issue.

posts.name: kgzak
posts.cooked: It‚Äôs the prevent cross-site tracking option in safari. You have to disable it to get mkcad to work. There isn‚Äôt a way to disable it on just one page, it‚Äôs either disabled or enabled. I tend to just switch to Firefox when I need to use mkcad.

posts.name: ehochstein
posts.cooked: Some additional details: All of our computers are running Debian and we are using onshape with Chromium. In order to get FRCDesign Deriver to load, we just had to enable 3rd party cookies while at cad.onshape.com . Thanks @dydx for the guidance!
